lead_paragraph: In a breathtaking spree that lasted little more than a week, the Patriots signed linebacker Adalius Thomas, tight end Kyle Brady and running back Sammy Morris, and traded for receiver Wes Welker. Later, they added receiver Donte’ Stallworth and, on draft weekend, stunned the league by trading for Randy Moss, who took a pay cut because he wanted to join the Patriots. The team insisted that was not unusual.
